publications.title: Game of thoughts: Iterative reasoning in game-theoretic domains with large language models
publications.authors: B Kempinski, I Gemp, K Larson, M Lanctot, Y Bachrach, T Kachman
publications.venue: International Foundation for Autonomous Agents and Multiagent Systems
publications.abstract: Large language models demonstrate impressive zero-shot reasoning abilities, but struggle significantly with long-term strategic reasoning in single or multiagent settings.

publications.title: Theory-of-Mind Challenges for LLM Agents
publications.authors: T Kachman, Y Bachrach, and collaborators
publications.abstract: Push the boundaries of AI social intelligence through persuasion, trust, and strategic cooperation across four mind-bending challenges.

publications.title: Modeling chemical reaction networks using neural ordinary differential equations
publications.authors: ACM Thöni, WE Robinson, Y Bachrach, WTS Huck, T Kachman
publications.venue: Journal of Chemical Information and Modeling
publications.abstract: We present a novel approach to modeling chemical reaction networks using neural ordinary differential equations for improved prediction and discovery.

publications.title: What can attribution methods show us about chemical language models?
publications.authors: S Hödl, T Kachman, Y Bachrach, WTS Huck, WE Robinson
publications.abstract: We investigate attribution methods to understand how chemical language models make predictions and what chemical features they learn.

publications.title: Self-organized resonance during search of a diverse chemical space
publications.authors: T Kachman, JA Owen, JL England
publications.abstract: We demonstrate how self-organized resonance emerges during the search of diverse chemical spaces, providing insights into complex adaptive systems.

publications.title: Modelling Mean-Field Games with Neural Ordinary Differential Equations
publications.authors: A Thöni, Y Bachrach, T Kachman
publications.abstract: We present a novel approach to modeling mean-field games using neural ordinary differential equations.

publications.title: InfluenceNet: AI Models for Banzhaf and Shapley Value Prediction
publications.abstract: We develop AI models for efficient prediction of Banzhaf and Shapley values in cooperative games.

publications.title: Neural payoff machines: Predicting fair and stable payoff allocations among team members
publications.authors: D Cornelisse, T Rood, Y Bachrach, M Malinowski, T Kachman
publications.venue: Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems
publications.abstract: We introduce neural payoff machines for predicting fair and stable payoff allocations in cooperative settings.

publications.title: Gradients are Not All You Need
publications.authors: Jonathan Lorraine, Jack Parker-Holder, Paul Vicol, Aldo Pacchiano, Luke Metz, Tal Kachman, Jakob Foerster
publications.abstract: We investigate the limitations of gradient-based optimization in neural networks and propose alternative approaches.

publications.title: Lyapunov exponents for diversity in differentiable games
publications.authors: J Lorraine, P Vicol, J Parker-Holder, T Kachman
publications.abstract: We use Lyapunov exponents to analyze diversity in differentiable games and understand training dynamics.

publications.title: Using bifurcations for diversity in differentiable games
publications.authors: Jonathan Lorraine, Jack Parker-Holder, Paul Vicol, Aldo Pacchiano, Luke Metz, Tal Kachman, Jakob Foerster
publications.venue: ICML 2021 Beyond First Order Methods Workshop
publications.abstract: We explore how bifurcations in training dynamics can lead to diversity in differentiable games.
